in that case, these may help: $# counts no. arguments, and you can use "for i in `seq 1 $#`" to iterate the number of times that there are arguments
alternately, you can do everything on the $1 argument, "shift" every time you're finished and reiterate until $# = 0

line 10 checks if there is a .rar extension - grep counts the lines with .rar present. if it's not present, it warns you that it's probably not going to work because it's probably the wrong filetype
if .rar isn't present, it then prompts you for whether you want to try unrar it anyway
the second choice with opt checks if it's a parted or normal rar file and handles the deletion of files accordingly
if the file DOES have .rar in the filename, it just does the normal stuff
